intro: Microstylis rheedei, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered spikes of flowers that are typically pale green to brown in color. Microstylis rheedei thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
